âš¡ Benchmarks

BLite performance benchmarks vs LiteDB 5.0.21 and SQLite+JSON (Microsoft.Data.Sqlite + System.Text.Json) using BenchmarkDotNet on .NET 10.

ğŸ“Š Benchmark Environment
  • OS: Windows 11 (10.0.22631.6495 / 23H2)
  • CPU: Intel Core i7-13800H â€” 14 physical cores, 20 logical @ 2.50GHz
  • Runtime: .NET 10.0.2 (X64 RyuJIT x86-64-v3)
  • BenchmarkDotNet: v0.15.8
  • Last Run: February 21, 2026

Engines: BLite (source-generated mappers) Â· LiteDB 5.0.21 (Connection=direct) Â· SQLite Microsoft.Data.Sqlite 10.0.2 + Dapper 2.1.66 (JSON blobs)

Document Schema

All benchmarks use a realistic e-commerce CustomerOrder document (~1â€“2 KB each):

CustomerOrder
â”œâ”€â”€ Id, OrderNumber, PlacedAt, Status, Currency
â”œâ”€â”€ Subtotal, TaxAmount, Total

1000 documents. Status distribution: ~25% each across pending Â· confirmed Â· shipped Â· delivered.

âš ï¸ Note on SQLite allocations

SQLite reports minimal managed allocations because work is delegated to its native C library. Unmanaged memory is not captured by BenchmarkDotNet. BLite allocations are fully measured (100% managed code).

Read Performance

Results from DefaultJob â€” standard BenchmarkDotNet multi-iteration run (most reliable).

Serialization (BSON vs JSON)

Standalone serialization â€” no I/O, measured on a complex nested object.

Why BLite Is Faster

  • âœ… C-BSON Format â€” Field name compression (2-byte IDs vs full string keys)
  • âœ… Zero-Copy I/O â€” Direct Span<byte> operations throughout the pipeline
  • âœ… Memory Pooling â€” ArrayPool for buffer reuse
  • âœ… Stack Allocation â€” stackalloc for temporary buffers
  • âœ… Source Generators â€” Compile-time serialization, no reflection at runtime
  • âœ… vs LiteDB â€” LiteDB uses reflection-based BSON and a B+ tree requiring page splits; BLite's generated mappers and append-only WAL eliminate per-document reflection overhead

Running Benchmarks

# Full BenchmarkDotNet run (all engines, all categories)
dotnet run -c Release --project src/BLite.Benchmark

# Quick manual run (~10s, no BDN overhead)
dotnet run -c Release --project src/BLite.Benchmark -- manual

# Results:
# src/BLite.Benchmark/BenchmarkDotNet.Artifacts/results/
